descriptions.description: TagLib is a library for reading and editing the meta-data of several popular audio formats. Currently it supports both ID3v1 and ID3v2 for MP3 files, Ogg Vorbis comments and ID3 tags and Vorbis comments in FLAC, MPC, Speex, WavPack TrueAudio, WAV, AIFF, MP4 and ASF files.

set.commands:
PACKAGE_NAME=taglib PACKAGE_VERSION=1.9.1
oegimport zlib #oegimport cmake
oegextract ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}.tar.gz
mkdir -p "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}" cp AUTHORS COPYING.* "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}/"
# -DBUILD_EXAMPLES=ON # -DENABLE_STATIC=ON -DENABLE_STATIC_RUNTIME=ON
cmake -G "MSYS Makefiles" \ -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR} \ -DZLIB_ROOT=${OEG_BASE_DIR} \ -DZLIB_INCLUDE_DIR=${OEG_BASE_DIR}/include \ -DZLIB_LIBRARY=${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR}/libz.a \ -DCMAKE_VERBOSE_MAKEFILE=on \ -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=true \ -DCMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME=Windows \ -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release .
make make install # no strip?
cd "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}"
mv bin bin64 mv lib lib64 # TODO: Do we need to edit the .la files in lib64?
oegarchive ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}
